Page Title: "Convocation, B.P. Koirala and Picnic of Communist Party [1957-1965]"
Description: This album consists of variety of subjects. The first few photographs of this album consists of the convocation of Tribhuvan University, the ceremony was chaired by late King Mahendra. During this ceremony, the graduation was awarded by Queen Ratna. This album also contain the photographs of the picnic organized by Nepal Communist Party. During this picnic, most of the famous leaders of Nepal communist party like Puspa Lal Shrestha, Manamohan Adhikari, Sahana Pradhan, Sadhana Pradhan were present. The same album also contain some photographs of B. P. Koirala, former and the first elected Prime minister of Nepal. It also contain the photographs of Kanti Hospital (later Kanti Children's Hospital). This album also contain the photographs of Madanmani Dixit and his family in different areas like Kalaiya, Central Zoo, Balaju Park, etc.                                                          View images from this file (233)
Legal: Access is for research purposes only

Description: The photographs are of Tibet when the Francis Younghusband led the mission to invade Tibet. In 1903 a substantial army was assembled in Sikkim and camped some 15 miles north of Sikkimese border at Khampa dzong where the leaders of the mission put forth repeated efforts to bring Tibetans to the negotiating table. Though the battles that took place are hardly a proud chapter in British military history John Claude White’s incomparable photographs have turned out to be the only lasting legacy of the ill-fated adventure of the Imperial Raj into Tibet.                                                          View images from this file (80)
Legal: White, John Claude, 1853-1918

Description: King Tribhuhvan Bir Bikram Shah Dev, King of Nepal (June 30, 1906 – March 13, 1955) was King of Nepal from 11 December 1911 until his death, excepting a period in 1950-51. Born in Kathmandu (Nepal's capital city), he ascended to the throne at the age of five, upon the death of his father, King Prithvi Bir Bikram Shah, and crowned on 20 February 1913 at the Nasal Chowk, Hanuman Dhoka Palace in Kathmandu, with his mother acting as regent. The album covers the images of the day of crowning him as King when Sri 3 Maharaja Chandra Shumsher was exercising full fledged power. The album also consists of hunting expedition mainly features Kaiser Shumsher, son of Chandra Shumsher, at the age of twenty one. Description: The photographs are of Kotti-hom which occurred for one month period organized by Balkumari Maharani in Bal-Chandra Palace i.e. Nepali kothi, Banaras. Kotti-hom is a ritual of offering the specially prepared mixture of rice, ghee and other things to the fire, a 10 million times. The Kotti-hom was managed by Col. Bhupal Shumsher. (The details of photographer Pashupati Lall could not be traced which is printed in cover of the album).                                                          View images from this file (27)

Description: Maj. Gen. Madan Shumsher JBR was son of Shri 3 Maharaja Chandra Shumsher. The picture covers the trip of Madan Shumsher to Baraha Kshetra. He was accompanied by his maternal uncle Karna Bikram Shah and tutor Kedarmani Dixit to the Baraha Kshetra temple. Madan Shumsher’s game trip with Karna Bikram is also captured in the pictures.                                                          View images from this file (41)

Description: The album covers the pictures of three Rana Priemers – Juddha, Padma and Mohan Shumsher. The album consist the images of foreign envoys in Nepal during that period. The main features of this album are leaving Prime ministership by Juddha to Padma, appointment of Shingha Shumsher as ambassador, enactment of law by Padma Shumsher etc.                                                          View images from this file (141)

Page Title: Juddha Shumsher JBR at a game [1945]
Description: Juddha Shumsher JBR remained in office as Prime minister from 1932 AD to 1945 AD. The album covers the images of Juddha Shumsher in a hunting expedition with the foreign envoy in Chitwan.                                                          View images from this file (41)

Description: Maj. Gen. Bishnu Shumsher JBR was a son of Sri 3 Maharaja Chandra Shumsher. He died on 29 Jan., 1946 at Nassau, Bahamas. The album contains the picture of the bringing of the body of Bishnu Shumsher from Bahamas to Banaras and the rituals taken place in his funeral. (The cover contains a note – the album was made to reach to then Sri 3 Mohan Shumsher but for some reasons stayed with Madan Shumsher). Description: The photographs of the accession day of His Highness Maharaja Mohan Shumsher Jung Bahadur Rana and of “Sindoor Jatra”. Page Title: Death rituals of Col. Bhupal Shumsher JBR in Banaras [1951]
Description: Colonel Bhupal Shumsher JBR, son of Fateh Shumsher, was an engineer and industrialist. He was an influential person and was seen as near person of Madan Shumsher JBR, a son of Rana Priemer Chandra Shumsher. He resided in Banaras due to few internal conflicts among Rana family. He died in Banaras. The picture covers the thirteen day rituals performed in his funeral.
